learning_outcomes.description: Examine community profiles and social determinants of health in Australia and globally.
Describe contemporary theories of human development as they relate to lifespan development.
Work in teams to discuss and apply principles of health promotion and ill health prevention across the lifespan and in different contexts.
Identify key priorities in promoting and preventing ill health across the lifespan stages.
Apply principles of health promotion and illness prevention to lifespan stages.

assessments.task_description: In this assessment you will analyse community profiles and assess how the social determinants of health affect the well-being of individuals.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard. Please check the companion website assessment area for specific instructions on this process. A link will be made available in the assessment area of your Blackboard course to allow you to submit your assignment electronically.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: To assess knowledge and application of the principles of health, health promotion and human development.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment is run through UQ Inspera. Submission is through UQ Inspera platform.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
13/10/2025 - 22/10/2025

Buddy Check Formative Peer Review: Week 8 Friday @ 1pm 19/09/2025 (no marks attached to this)

Social media reel/post and planning sheet: Week 10 Friday @ 1pm 10/10/2025

Buddy Check Summative Peer Review: Week 10 Friday @ 1pm 10/10/2025

Presentation: Week 11 or 12 during IBL class time
assessments.mode: Activity/ Performance, Oral, Product/ Artefact/ Multimedia, Written
assessments.task_description:
This is a group assessment and will require you to work in groups of 4-6. The groups will be provided with a range of lifespan topics related to health promotion and illness prevention. As a group you will:

1.   Create a health education video or social media reel/post aimed at a specific lifespan group, focusing on a chosen health topic (2-3 minutes).

2.   Explain the behind the scenes: Rationale & Research for the health promotion video or social media reel/post including planning sheet (5 minutes).

3.   Run a live engagement activity (5 minutes).

4.   Explain the behind the scenes: Rationale & Research for the live engagement activity including planning sheet (5 minutes).

5.   Provide a wrap-up & key message (1–2 minutes).

Complete the summative buddy check online assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard. Please check the companion website assessment area for specific instructions on this process. A link will be made available in the assessment area of your Blackboard course to allow you to submit your assignment electronically.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 3(28 Jul - 17 Aug)
learning_activities.topic:
Module 1 - Key Foundations

This module forms the basis of this course. It will cover understanding definitions of health and determinants of health, health promotion and human development.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1 - Key Foundations This module forms the basis of this course. It will cover understanding definitions of health and determinants of health, health promotion and human development.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture One - Week 1

This lecture will introduce you to the course and assessments.
We will also look at different lifespan stages and the determinants of health for each stage.


Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture One - Week 1 This lecture will introduce you to the course and assessments. We will also look at different lifespan stages and the determinants of health for each stage.

learning_activities.topic:
IBL 1 - Week 2

Your first IBL will introduce you to different community profiles and the social determinants of health. This will help with Assessment 1. You will also form groups for Assessment 2.


Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: IBL 1 - Week 2 Your first IBL will introduce you to different community profiles and the social determinants of health. This will help with Assessment 1. You will also form groups for Assessment 2.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 6(18 Aug - 07 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Module 2 - Prenatal to toddlerhood

This module covers prenatal to toddlerhood. It explores developmental progress of each stage, the role of the nurse in assessment as well as health promotion for this lifespan group.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 2 - Prenatal to toddlerhood This module covers prenatal to toddlerhood. It explores developmental progress of each stage, the role of the nurse in assessment as well as health promotion for this lifespan group.

learning_activities.topic:
IBL 2 - Week 4

This week we will be exploring Human Development and the Lifespan groups in more detail. Please note EKKA holiday falls in this period and those affected classes will be notified and given online learning.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: IBL 2 - Week 4 This week we will be exploring Human Development and the Lifespan groups in more detail. Please note EKKA holiday falls in this period and those affected classes will be notified and given online learning.

Health promotion Strategies and Principles.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: IBL 3 - Week 6 Health promotion Strategies and Principles.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 9(08 Sep - 28 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Module 3 - Early childhood to adolescence

This module covers early childhood, middle childhood and adolescence. It explores developmental progress of each stage, the role of the nurse in assessment as well as health promotion for this lifespan group.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 3 - Early childhood to adolescence This module covers early childhood, middle childhood and adolescence. It explores developmental progress of each stage, the role of the nurse in assessment as well as health promotion for this lifespan group.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture Two - Week 7

This lecture will look at Assessment 2 and 3 in more detail.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture Two - Week 7 This lecture will look at Assessment 2 and 3 in more detail.

learning_activities.topic:
IBL 4 - Week 8

This session you will work in your groups to complete Assessment 2 and receive a Peer Review of Assessment 2. You will also have time to complete a formative buddy check on your Assessment 2 group members.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04

This week will be the start of your presentations. It is expected that you attend even if you are not presenting to support your peers. You will also complete a summative peer review of your group members.
